description.value:
You magically animate either a large object or a group of smaller objects, which begin floating in the air.

Summoning Spell

  • Both Objects

    • Are &reference[construct]{constructs} and act immediately after the end of your turns. The objects follow your commands, otherwise only defending themselves from attackers.

    • Are immune to &reference[poison]{poison} and &reference[psychic]{psychic} damage, and immune to the &reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}, &reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, &reference[prone]{prone}, &reference[unconscious], and &reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion} conditions.

    • Have &reference[blindsight] within 60 ft. and are blind beyond that radius.

    • Have a flying speed of 30 ft.

    • Have a melee attack they can use on their turn:

  • Melee Attack - 1 Creature (5 ft.)

    • Attack Bonus: +8

    • Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + 4 bludgeoning]] damage.*

  • Large Object

    • It is a large &reference[construct]{construct}.

    • It can carry medium or smaller creatures like a mount or vehicle.

    • It has AC 15, 60 hit points,* and all its ability scores are 2, except &reference[strength]{strength}, which is 18, &reference[constitution]{constitution}, which is 14, and &reference[dexterity]{dexterity} which is 10.

  • Large Swarm of Objects

    • It is a swarm of tiny and/or small &reference[construct]{constructs}.

    • As a swarm, it has resistance to all damage meant to damage a single creature, and vulnerability to area of effect damage. It also has the standard @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-creature-features.Item.WpPWeLaBqUVj2mlj]{swarm features}.

    • It has AC 15, 40 hit points,* and all its ability scores are 2, except &reference[dexterity]{dexterity}, which is 18, &reference[constitution]{constitution}, which is 14, and &reference[strength]{strength} which is 10.

*Upcasting: The object(s)'s damage increases by [[/r 1d10 fire]]{1d10} for each spell level above 5th level. For each spell level above 5th level, it also gains more hit points: 15 hit points for large objects and 10 hit points for swarms.

An object might be animated but start &reference[grappled] or &reference[restrained] if fastened to something or part of something larger.
